item.title: Lauren add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "I wish I could freeze this moment, right here, right now and live in it forever." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Ally Condie
item.description: "His lips move silently, and I know what he says: the words of a poem that only two people in the world know." -- Ally Condie

item.title: Lauren add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Angry, and half in love with her, and tremendously sorry, I turned away." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Becca Fitzpatrick
item.description: "Being with you never felt wrong. It's the one thing I did right. You're the one thing I did right." -- Becca Fitzpatrick

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You know, you could live a thousand lifetimes and not deserve him." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Lauren Kate
item.description: "She took comfort in the soft occasional sound of turning pages." -- Lauren Kate

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description: "Boys turns girls into such idiots." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Stephanie Perkins
item.description:
"Once upon a time, there was a girl who talked to the moon. And she was mysterious and she was perfect, in that way that girls who talk to moons are. In the house next door, there lived a boy. And the boy watched the girl grow more and more perfect, more and more beautiful with each passing year. He watched her watch the moon. And he began to wonder if the moon would help him unravel the mystery of the beautiful girl. So the boy looked into the sky. But he couldn't concentrate on the moon. He was too distracted by the stars. And it didn't matter how many songs or poems had already been written about them, because whenever he thought about the girl, the stars shone brighter. As if she were the one keeping them illuminated.
One day, the boy had to move away. He couldn't bring the girl with him, so he brought the stars. When he'd look out his window at night, he would start with one. One star. And the boy would make a wish on it, and the wish would be her name.
At the sound of her name, a second star would appear. And then he'd wish her name again, and the stars would double into four. And four became eight, and eight became sixteen, and so on, in the greatest mathematical equation the universe had ever seen. And by the time an hour had passed, the sky would be filled with so many stars that it would wake the neighbors. People wondered who'd turned on the floodlights.
The boy did. By thinking about the girl." -- Stephanie Perkins

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "It's not that I believe everything happens for a reason. It's just that... I just think that some things are meant to be broken. Imperfect. Chaotic. It's the universe's way of providing contrast, you know? There have to be a few holes in the road. It's how life is." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "I can say I made a lot of mistakes, but I don't regret things. Because at least I didn't spend a life standing outside, wondering what living would be like." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "All grown-ups were once children... but only few of them remember it." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Well, I must endure the presence of a few caterpillars if I wish to become acquainted with the butterflies." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Lauren Oliver
item.description: "I love you. Remember. They cannot take it" -- Lauren Oliver

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Lauren Oliver
item.description: "You can't be happy unless you're unhappy sometimes"." -- Lauren Oliver

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Veronica Roth
item.description: "I have a theory that selflessness and bravery aren't all that different." -- Veronica Roth

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "If no one in the entire world cared about you, did you really exist at all?" -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "One must always be careful of books," said Tessa, "and what is inside them, for words have the power to change us." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Becca Fitzpatrick
item.description: "If I lose you, I lose everything" -- Becca Fitzpatrick

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Ally Condie
item.description: "In the end you can't always choose what to keep. You can only choose how you let it go." -- Ally Condie

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Ally Condie
item.description: "<i>I love.</i> The most reckless thing of all." -- Ally Condie

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Ally Condie
item.description: "Everyone has something of beauty about them. But loving let's you look, and look, and look again. You notice the back of a hand, the turn of a head, the way of a walk. When you first love, you look blind and you see it all as the glorious, beloved whole, or a beautiful sum of beautiful parts. But when you see the one you love as pieces, as why's, you can love those parts too, and it's a love at once more complicated and more complete." -- Ally Condie

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Ally Condie
item.description: "Love has different shades. Like the way I loved Cassia when I thought she'd never love me. The way I loved her on the Hill. The way I love her now that she came into the canyon for me. It's different. Deeper. I thought I loved her and wanted her before, but as we walk through the canyon together I realize this could be more than a new shade. A whole new color." -- Ally Condie

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You're still trying to protect me. Real or not real," he whispers. "Real," I answer. "Because that's what you and I do, protect each other." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "It takes ten times as long to put yourself back together as it does to fall apart." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "I must have loved you a lot." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "You're a painter. You're a baker. You like to sleep with the windows open. You never take sugar in your tea. And you always double-knot your shoelaces." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "There's a chance that the old Peeta, the one who loves you, is still inside. Trying to get back to you. Don't give up on him." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Cassandra Clare
item.description: "We live and breathe words. .... It was books that made me feel that perhaps I was not completely alone. They could be honest with me, and I with them. Reading your words, what you wrote, how you were lonely sometimes and afraid, but always brave; the way you saw the world, its colors and textures and sounds, I felt--I felt the way you thought, hoped, felt, dreamt. I felt I was dreaming and thinking and feeling <i>with</i> you. I dreamed what you dreamed, wanted what you wanted--and then I realized that truly I just wanted you." -- Cassandra Clare

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description:
"I raise my left arm and twist my neck down to rip off the pill on my sleeve. Instead my teeth sink into flesh. I yank my head back in confusion to find myself looking into Peeta’s eyes, only now they hold my gaze. Blood runs from the teeth marks on the hand he clamped over my nightlock.
“Let me go!” I snarl at him, trying to wrest my arm from his grasp.
“I can’t,” he says." -- Suzanne Collins

item.title: Lauren add a quote by Suzanne Collins
item.description: "One more time? For the audience?" he says. His voice isn't angry. It's hollow, which is worse. Already the boy with the bread is slipping away from me. I take his hand, holding on tightly, preparing for the cameras, and dreading the moment when I will finally have to let go." -- Suzanne Collins
